inclusiveLanguageImplementation.philosophy: Inclusive binary language recognizes and respects gender diversity by avoiding generic masculine defaults, using gender-neutral terms, and explicitly acknowledging multiple genders

method1.name: Gender-Neutral Role Terminology (PRIMARY)
method1.description: Use gender-neutral English equivalents for Spanish gendered roles

method2.name: Inclusive Pronouns (SECONDARY)
method2.description: Use gender-neutral or paired-form pronouns for gender-inclusive reference
examples: él o ella → he or she / they

method3.name: Gender-Neutral Verb Forms (AUTOMATIC)
method3.description: English verbs and past participles are naturally gender-neutral
examples: ha sido asignado/a → has been assigned

styleSupportingDocuments: APA 7th Edition - Explicitly supports singular they
Chicago Manual of Style 17th Edition - Permits singular they
CMOS (Council of Science Editors) - Accepts singular they in formal writing
